Home / News & Events / Event Archives / 2nd GC Learning Forum Berlin 2002

Second International Global Compact Learning Forum Meeting

Berlin, 11-13 December 2002 

Meeting Reports 

Learning from Experience: The UN Global Compact Learning Forum 2002 (PDF, 455kb) - Comprehensive meeting report by Sandra Waddock, Boston College
Meeting Agenda (PDF, 266kb) 
Foreword (PDF, 129 kb)

Keynote Speeches

Georg Kell , Executive Head, Global Compact Office (PDF, 152 kb)
Dr. Bernd Eisenblaetter , Chief Executive Officer, Deutsche Gesellschaft für Technische Zusammenarbeit (PDF, 147 kb)
Erich Stather , State Secretary, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) (PDF, 184 kb)
Ellen Kallinowsky , Head of Learning, Global Compact Office (PDF, 209 kb)

Plenary Sessions

Integrating CSR into Corporate Strategy, Management and Systems, Andrew Wilson, Ashridge Centre for Business and Society and Elena Bonfiglioli, CSR-Europe (PDF, 671kb) 

Designing an Effective CSR Structure , Aron Cramer, Business for Social Responsibility (PDF, 191 kb)

Human Rights and Corporate Responses , Salil Tripathi, Amnesty International (PDF, 2.4 Mb)

The case for a tenth principle , Jermyn Brooks, Transparency International 

Sector analysis - an example from the coffee sector , Jo Nickolls, Oxfam (PDF, 124 kb)

The Global Compact and the Challenges of Global Governance , Prof. John G. Ruggie, Harvard University, Kennedy School of Government (PDF, 146 kb)

Lessons Learned from Multi-Stakeholder Approaches Supported by German Development Cooperation , Hans P. Schipulle, German Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ) (PDF, 135 kb)

The Commission's Communication "Corporate Social Responsibility: A business contribution to sustainable development" , Pedro Ortun, European Commission (PDF, 154 kb)

The Global Compact Policy Dialogues , Denise O'Brien, Global Compact Office (PDF, 155 kb)

Shaping Attitudes: The Media and Globalization , Gavin Power, Global Compact Office (PDF, 947 kb)

Media and Stakeholder Opinions towards CSR , Nigel Middlemiss, Echo Research (PDF, 4 Mb)

Sustainable consumption and the role of advertising and communication , Cornis Lugt, UNEP (PDF, 559kb)

The Global Learning Initiative , Prof. Gilbert Lenssen, European Academy of Business in Society (PDF, 163 kb)

Back to the Business of Ethics? , Judith Samuelson, Aspen ISIB 

Workgroup Presentations

Transparency paper from policy dialogue : Miguel Schloss, Transparency International (PDF, 231 kb)

Business Ethics : Bjoern Edlund, ABB Ltd. (PDF, 1.6 Mb)

Warwick University: An analytical framework on social standards : Prof. Alyson Warhurst, Warwick Business School (PDF, 203 kb)

Human Rights in the Supply Chain, experiences from the GC Nordic Network: Magnus Enell, ITT Flygt AG, Christine Nesset, Statoil

The Bottom of the Supply Chain: The Perspective of Brazilians SMEs : Vivian Smith, Global Compact Office (PDF, 197 kb)

Globalization, Sustainable Development and Employment : Jim Baker, International Confederation of Free Trade Unions (ICFTU) (PDF, 161 kb)

Global works council and cooperative conflict management : Reinhold Kopp, Volkswagen AG (PDF, 4.3 Mb)

Employers' realities and public expectations - challenges for the workplace : Brent Wilton, International Organization of Employers (IOE) (PDF, 172 kb)

The Global Compact Performance Model : Claude Fussler, World Business Council for Sustainable Development (WBCSD) (PDF, 514 kb)

Reporting, a major element of performance : Ralph Thurm, Global Reporting Initiative (PDF, 275 kb)

Case Studies

Novartis Case Study, Switzerland: "Novartis and the United Nations Global Compact Initiative" , Prof. Dr. Lee Tavis, University of Notre Dame and Prof. Dr. Klaus M. Leisinger, Novartis Foundation for Sustainable Development (PDF, 532kb) kb)
 
Spedpol Case Study, Poland: "Ethical Principles: A tool for empowerment" , Prof. Boleslaw Rok, Business Ethics Centre- Institute of Philosophy and Sociology, L. Kozminski Academy of Entrepreneurship and Management and Stefan Bulaszewski, Spedpol (PDF, 299 kb)

Designworks USA/BMW Group Case Study, USA: "Designing Sustainability at BMW Group: The DesignworksUSA Experience" , Prof. Kellie A. McElhaney, Haas School of Business, Berkeley University of California and Greg Brew, Designworks USA/ BMW Group (PDF, 235 kb)

"The Contribution of Private Investment to Sustainable Development: a Framework" , Glen Armstrong, International Finance Corporation (IFC) (PDF, 263 kb)

HDFC Case Study, India: "Indian Association for Savings and Credit" , Ravi Puranik, Partners in Change and Harish Khare, HDFC (PDF, 175 kb)

Broad Air Conditioning Case Study, China: "Broad Air Conditioning and the environmental imperative", Prof. Zhiyi He, Guanghua School of Management- Peking University and Yue Zhang, Broad Air Conditioning (PDF, 77 kb)

BASF Case Study, Germany: "BASF's Eco-Efficiency Analysis" , Frank Czymmek, University of Cologne and Joerg Hartmann, BASF Aktiengesellschaft (PDF, 206 kb)

Samarco Mineracao S.A. Case Study, Brazil: "Salvamar Project: One Project, One Idea" , Prof. Claudio Boechat, Fundação Dom Cabral and Francisco Antônio Dutra, Samarco Mineracao S.A. (PDF, 1.6 Mb)

Back to the Business of Ethics? , Judith Samuelson, Aspen ISIB
 
Kikkoman Case Study, Japan: "Environmental Preservation and Other Efforts of Kikkoman Corporation", Prof. Toru Umeda, Reitaku University and Kazuo Shimizu, Kikkoman Corporation (PDF, 167 kb)

Skanska Case Study, Sweden: "In search of ecological excellence - Skanska's environmental management at the Kukule Ganga Hydropower Project" , Prof. Hans De Geer, Stockholm School of Economics and Axel Wenblad, Skanska AB (PDF, 506 kb)

Eskom Case Study, South Africa: "Flexible Hot Water Load Management Control System" , Mokhethi Moshoeshoe, African Institute for Corporate Citizenship and Albert Africa, Eskom (PDF, 210 kb)

DaimlerChrysler Case Study, Germany/South Africa: "DaimlerChrysler South Africa's response to HIV/ AIDS" , Dr. B. Seitz, Stuttgart Institute for Management and Technology and Josef Rückert, DaimlerChrysler South Africa (PDF, 427 kb)

Heineken's HIV/AIDS Policy , Dr. H. Rijckborst, Heineken Medical Group (PPT, 229 kb)

Speaker's Bios (PDF, 1,3 Mb)
